description: The Chief Minister Nari Shakti Yojana in Bihar focuses on the social, cultural, and economic empowerment of women through financial assistance, skill development, and support for self-help groups (SHGs). It aims to enhance womenâ€™s independence and community participation.

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to Rs. 5 Lakhs for SHG-based enterprises
benefits.training: Free skill development and entrepreneurship training

residency_criteria: Must be a resident of Bihar
group_criteria: Members of registered womenâ€™s Self-Help Groups (SHGs)

eligible_activities: Skill development in trades like tailoring, handicrafts, or food processing
Marketing and promotion of SHG products

steps: Obtain the application form from the District Women and Child Development Office
Submit the application through the SHG with a business plan
Attach required documents, including SHG registration and residency proof
Applications are reviewed by a district-level committee
Approved SHGs receive funding and training support
application_process.note: Applications must be submitted through registered SHGs

special_notes: Funding is provided to SHGs, not individuals
Priority is given to SHGs with viable business plans
Beneficiaries must participate in training programs
